Result.Title: A case for redundant arrays of inexpensive disks (RAID)

Result.Abstract: Reliable transport protocols such as TCP are tuned to perform well in traditional networks where packet losses occur mostly because of congestion. TCP responds to all losses by invoking congestion control and avoidance algorithms, resulting in degraded
Result.Title: A Comparison of Mechanisms for Improving TCP Performance over Wireless Links

Result.Title: The Eifel algorithm: making TCP robust against spurious retransmissions

Result.Title: RAID-II: A High-Bandwidth Network File Server

Result.Abstract: A design database organizes the description of an artifact, by arranging it as a hierarchical composition of components across multiple representations. It is particularly difficult to manage this complex structure as it evolves over time. In this paper, we present a logical organization for describing designs across time. We also present an operational model, based on workspaces and transactions, that
Result.Title: A version server for computer-aided design data

Result.Abstract: Abstract - Traceroute is used heavily by network operators and researchers to identify the IP forwarding path from a source to a destination In practice, knowing the Autonomous System (AS) associated  with  each  hop  in  the  path  is  also  quite  valuable In previous  work  we  showed  that  the  IP - to - AS  mapping  extracted from BGP routing tables is
Result.Title: Scalable and Accurate Identification of AS-level Forwarding Paths
